articles.author: Jasper Ward
articles.description: While Patel did not provide further details, he said in a post on social media that FBI agents and local law enforcement are on the scene.
articles.title: FBI investigating 'targeted terror attack' in Boulder, Colorado, director says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two children were among those hospitalised, one of them in a serious condition.
articles.title: Seven killed after bridge collapse, train derailment in Russia's Bryansk region bordering Ukraine

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: The attack came as Hamas and Israel exchanged blame over a faltering effort to secure a ceasefire.
articles.title: Israeli attack near aid delivery point kills up to 31 in Gaza, local health authorities say

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: The proposal begins with a ceasefire of at least 30 days and a full prisoner exchange.
articles.title: Exclusive: Ukraine to set out roadmap for peace at Istanbul talks, document shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Bessent said he believes President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping will speak soon to address trade issues, including rare minerals.
articles.title: Trump, Xi likely to speak soon, Treasury's Bessent says

articles.author: Barbara Erling, Anna Wlodarczak-Semczuk
articles.description: Trzaskowski campaigned on a promise to help the government of Prime Minister Donald Tusk complete its democratic reforms.
articles.title: Poland's Trzaskowski on course for tight presidential election win

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea condemned a multilateral sanctions monitoring group's recent report on ties with Russia as political and biased, saying its military cooperation with Moscow was a "legitimate exercise of the sovereign right," state media said on Monday.
articles.title: North Korea criticises 'hostile' monitoring group's report on Russia ties

articles.author: Ahmed Eljechtimi
articles.description: Britain's foreign minister, David Lammy, said on Sunday that the UK considers Morocco's autonomy proposal as the most feasible basis to resolve the conflict over Western Sahara.
articles.title: UK backs Morocco's autonomy plan for Western Sahara, Lammy says

articles.author: Orathai Sriring, Thanadech Staporncharnchai, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Rungthiwa Pimphanit waited months for a long-promised cash handout of 10,000 baht ($307) from Thailand's ruling party, which she backed in 2023 elections, but now the scheme to stimulate a stalling economy has been put on ice.
articles.title: Thailand's stalled cash handout scheme sours voters on ruling party

articles.author: Greg Torode, Fanny Potkin
articles.description: At Shangri-La Dialogue, the US urges EU to focus on Europe—Europe pushes back, asserting Asia-Pacific ties.
articles.title: Europe bristles at US proposals at Asian gathering, India-Pakistan hostility on show
